metaTitle: Sell Gordon & MacPhail Whisky | Connoisseurs Choice & Private Collection | Proof Cellars
metaDescription: Sell your Gordon & MacPhail whisky. We buy Connoisseurs Choice, Private Collection, Macallan G&M, and rare licensed bottlings.
heroSubhead: Direct buyer for G&M Connoisseurs Choice, Private Collection, and rare Macallan.
introParagraph: Gordon & MacPhail is the custodian of Scotland's liquid history. Their warehouses hold some of the oldest whisky on earth, including legendary Macallan and Strathisla casks.
whatWeBuy: G&M Licensed Bottlings (Macallan, Talisker, Glenlivet, Strathisla)
G&M Connoisseurs Choice (Map Label & Old Brown Label)
whatWeDoNotBuy: G&M Distillery Labels (Standard 43% releases) - unless 30+ years old
photoChecklist: Front label showing Vintage and Distillery
conditionFactors: Label Era: 'Map Labels' (early Connoisseurs Choice) are collectible but often have fragile paper.
Licensed Bottlings: A G&M Macallan label looks different than a factory Macallan. It is highly prized.
Box: The new Private Collection wooden boxes are heavy and valuable.
Fill: Older screw-cap G&M bottles are prone to evaporation.
pricingFactors: Distillery: Top tier (Macallan, Talisker, Mortlach) G&M bottlings can be worth thousands.
Vintage: G&M is famous for 1940s/50s/60s vintages.
Label Style: The old 'Stencil' or 'Eagle' labels are history pieces.
ABV: Cask Strength editions beat the standard 40/43% range.

faqs.question: What is a 'Licensed Bottling'?
faqs.answer: For decades, G&M was the official bottler for distilleries like Macallan and Glenlivet. These 'Distillery Labels' are iconic.

faqs.question: Do you buy G&M Macallan?
faqs.answer: Yes, G&M Speymalt (Macallan) is one of our top buy targets.

faqs.question: What is the 'Map Label'?
faqs.answer: The 1970s/80s Connoisseurs Choice labels featuring a map of Scotland. Highly collectible.

faqs.question: Do you buy Generations?
faqs.answer: Yes, the 70, 75, and 80-year-old releases are ultra-premium.

faqs.question: Is 'Discovery' valuable?
faqs.answer: The color-coded Discovery range is an entry-level series. We buy it, but offers are wholesale.

faqs.question: How do I check the vintage?
faqs.answer: G&M always puts the Distillation Year on the label.
